title: 109_s765
content: The Act may be cited as the "Math and Science Incentive Act of 2005". Congress finds that the United States needs a strong scientific and technical enterprise, which requires producing more scientists and engineers. The education system must encourage students to study science and mathematics and pursue related careers, as current performance in these fields lags behind international peers. The United States needs to recommit to leadership in science, mathematics, and engineering, especially with advances in areas like nanotechnology. The current performance of US students in these fields lags behind international peers, and more students need to pursue science and mathematics careers. The country is still benefiting from past investments in research and education, but that capital is being depleted. The United States must recommit to leadership in science, mathematics, and engineering, particularly with advancements in nanotechnology. Implementing a loan forgiveness program to attract students to STEM careers, including teaching, can help maintain technological leadership. Establishment of program for STEM loan forgiveness. The Secretary will implement a program to cover interest payments on loans for undergraduate students who meet specific criteria outlined in the Act. The Secretary may assume interest payments for eligible borrowers who have obtained undergraduate loans and are teachers of STEM subjects at elementary schools. Eligibility criteria include submitting an application, being a new borrower, and meeting specific requirements outlined in the Act. New borrowers who are teachers of STEM subjects at elementary or secondary schools can have their interest payments assumed by the Secretary if they complete 5 consecutive years of service in that position. New borrowers who are teachers of STEM subjects at elementary or secondary schools, or mathematics, science, or engineering professionals, can have their interest payments assumed by the Secretary if they complete 5 consecutive years of service in a qualifying position. The Secretary will not make payments for interest that accrues before the repayment period begins on a loan. The Secretary will not make interest payments that accrue before the repayment period begins on a loan or before the signing of an agreement under the program. Participants for the program will be selected by the Secretary. The Secretary will select participants for the program based on national security, homeland security, and economic security needs of the United States, as determined in consultation with other Federal agencies. The Secretary will choose among eligible applicants based on the national security, homeland security, and economic security needs of the United States, in consultation with other Federal agencies and considering academic record or job performance. The Secretary will select eligible applicants based on national security, homeland security, and economic security needs of the United States, in consultation with other Federal agencies. Selection criteria include the applicant's academic record, job performance, likelihood to complete a 5-year service obligation, and remain in science, mathematics, or engineering. The Secretary will select eligible applicants based on national security, homeland security, and economic security needs of the United States. Criteria for selection include academic record, job performance, likelihood to complete a 5-year service obligation, and remain in science, mathematics, or engineering. Loan interest payments are subject to availability of funds and may be based on various criteria determined by the Secretary. Loan interest payments under this Act are subject to the availability of appropriations. If the appropriated amount is insufficient, priority will be given to individuals who received interest payments in the previous fiscal year. The Secretary will prioritize interest payments for qualified applicants based on previous fiscal year payments. The Secretary has the authority to create necessary regulations. The Secretary is authorized to prescribe regulations for carrying out the provisions of interest payments on behalf of student borrowers. The period for interest payments begins on the effective date of the agreement, continues after service obligation completion, and ends when the loan repayment period is completed or when $10,000 has been paid by the Secretary on behalf of the borrower. The period for interest payments on behalf of student borrowers selected under subsection (a) begins on the effective date of the agreement, continues after successful completion of the service obligation, and ends on the earlier of the completion of the loan repayment period, payment of $10,000 by the Secretary, or if the borrower ceases to fulfill the service obligation before the end of the 5-year period. The Secretary will make a $10,000 payment on behalf of the borrower if they fail to fulfill the service obligation before the end of the 5-year period or if their gross income exceeds 4 times the national per capita income for a calendar year. The Secretary will make a $10,000 payment on behalf of the borrower if they fail to fulfill the service obligation within 5 years or if their income exceeds 4 times the national per capita income for a calendar year. Repayment to eligible lenders will be made according to regulations set by the Secretary. The Secretary will repay eligible lenders for the interest accrued on loans of selected student borrowers, as determined by regulations. Eligible individuals must submit an accurate application for loan interest payment to the Secretary. The Secretary will repay eligible lenders for the interest accrued on loans of selected student borrowers. Eligible individuals must submit an accurate application for loan interest payment to the Secretary, including an agreement to complete the required service. The application for loan interest payment must include an agreement to complete the required service. If the individual fails to complete the service, they must repay the Secretary the interest amount. The individual must repay the Secretary for any interest paid on their behalf. Consolidation loans may qualify for interest payment if used to repay specific types of loans. Interest is paid under this section only if the loan amount was used to repay certain types of loans. Borrowers cannot receive benefits from both this section and certain loan forgiveness programs. Prevention of Double Benefits: Borrowers cannot receive benefits from both the Unsubsidized Stafford Loan program and certain loan forgiveness programs. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Education, and "mathematics, science, or engineering professional" is defined as someone with a degree in science, mathematics, or engineering working in a related field, including as a professor at a higher education institution. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal year 2006 and the following 5 years is provided under this Act.
